poem:
Title: "Of Lost Beginnings"

In the clandestine corridors of life's cradle,
Abortive hopes seep silent into unsuspecting wombs.
Forged by science, fractured by trust,
A toxic dance between desire and disaster.
Yet within the solemn echo of possible life's demise,
Bloom the resilient seeds of awarded grief.
Their quiet strength, a testament 
For those who listen to life's clandestine whispers.
